result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacarey L Fuller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 7 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to the State of Michigan through the inter-state compact if the State of Michigan is willing to accept.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No contact with the co-actors (ONLY exception of family members).
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court orders any items seized by law enforcement are forfeited and can be destroyed pursuant to statute.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Jacarey L Fuller in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.   

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Counts 11 & 12 are dismissed as read ins.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
7  Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  15 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to the State of Michigan through the inter-state compact if the State of Michigan is willing to accept.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  co-actors  ONLY acception is for those co-actors that are family members.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Restitution set @ $0.00
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the Posting Party.

Court authorizes the defendant's return to the State of Michigan following court today.
Court orders any items seized by law enforcement are forfeited and can be destroyed pursuant to statute.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
